accommodation_needed_couchsurfing: I need accomodation and would be fine with couchsurfing.
accommodation_needed_no_couchsurfing: I need accomodation but don't want to do couchsurfing.
accommodation_none: I will manage accommodation myself or have no need for it.
archive_description: Looking for information about one of our past conferences? Whether you're planning your own TaCoS, want to reminisce, or need to look something up, the pages from previous years are still available. Have fun browsing!
archive_link_title: List of all conferences at linguistik.computer
and_am_aware_i_can_be_excluded: and am aware that I can be excluded from the event in case of violations.
conference_description: At Universität Heidelberg, which was founded in 1386 and is thus the oldest university in Germany, Computational Linguistics is a relatively small field of study. Many people know Universität Heidelberg as a beautiful university in the old town, but there is also a brutalist building complex in the Neuenheimer Feld district, to which Heidelberg's Computational Linguistics was deported some time ago. You can admire the beauty of this complex in the background of this website right now, and hopefully in person in May 2026.
conference_description_lead: We look forward to welcoming you to Heidelberg from Thursday, May 21, 2026, to Saturday, May 23, 2026, for the 35th Computational Linguistics Student Conference (“Tagung der Computerlinguistik-Studierenden”).
contact_lead: Do you have questions, suggestions, or would you like to support us? Please feel free to contact us!
contact_mail_text: You can best reach us by email at
contact_mail_text_2: We look forward to your message!
couchsurfing: I would be willing to do couch surfing
go_to_archive_button: Haven't read enough? Go to the archive!
membership_already_member: Yes, I am already a member and pay the reduced fee.
membership_disclaimer: We will forward your email address to Junge Sprachwissenschaft e.V., which will send you a one-time information pack.
membership_label: Are you a member of Junge Sprachwissenschaft e. V.?
membership_not_member_full_fee: No, I am not a member and pay the full fee.
membership_not_member_info_requested: No, I am not a member yet, but would like to receive information about the association
newsletter_archive_description: You want to read an old newsletter, but you don't have the mail (anymore)? No problem: Here are all our newsletters we previously sent, orderd from oldest to newest:
newsletter_consent: I would like to subscribe to the newsletter and be informed about news regarding TaCoS. I can unsubscribe at any time. The receipt of the newsletter must be confirmed in the corresponding confirmation email.
newsletter_description: If you want to be the first to know when there's news, why not subscribe to the TaCoS newsletter? You can find old issues of the newsletter in our
participate_accommodation_description: We are currently planning this. We might arrange for a limited number of discounted rooms in a hostel or hotel, or perhaps couch surfing. In the worst case, you will unfortunately have to arrange your own accommodation.
participate_certificate: Can I get a certificate of participation?
participate_certificate_description: Sure. It is not yet clear whether we will issue certificates only upon request or automatically, but if you attend TaCoS (or even give a presentation), we can definitely certify that for you.
participate_description: The registration form will be made available on Ferbuary 9th, 2026. Please continue to be patient until then. If you would like to be informed as soon as registration opens, you can
participate_is_for_me: I have never been to a conference before. Is TaCoS something for me?
participate_is_for_me_description: Yes, absolutely! As a student conference, we have a very relaxed and open atmosphere. Even if you are only in your first semester or don't know exactly how a conference works, you are very welcome at TaCoS — for many people, TaCoS is their first conference.
participate_language: What is the language of the conference?
participate_language_description: Contributions are accepted in both English and German. The organizing team speaks (at least) German and English.
participate_presentation_howto: I want to present something. How can I do that?
participate_presentation_howto_descripti: ” you'll find the Call for Participation and a way to submit a contribution. Please also register as an attendee normally using the form on this page.
participate_presentation_needed: Do I have to present something in order to participate?
participate_presentation_needed_descript: No. Most participants do not give presentations, and that is perfectly acceptable. However, we appreciate every contribution (because without contributions there is no program, and without a program there is no conference).
participate_brunch: Will there be brunch on Sunday?
participate_brunch_description: Yes, on Sunday, May 24th, 2026, there will be the traditional unofficial brunch in a café in Heidelberg. You will receive information about this during the conference. If you want to participate, please consider this when planing your departure.
participate_deadline: What is the deadline for attendee registration?
participate_privacy: What do you use the registration data for?
participate_privacy_description: We will, of course, share the aggregated statistics with you during the conference.
previously_at_tacos: I've been to a TaCoS conference before.
privacy_affiliation: Is used to print it on your name tag, for statistics, and to determine the location of the 36th TaCoS 2027.
privacy_languages: To print them on your name tag and for statistics.
privacy_name: To be able to address you, identify you and print it on your name tag. If you use a mononym, enter it as your first name and leave the last name blank.
privacy_previously_at_tacos: For statistics, and to know whether we should particularly address first-time or repeat participants.
privacy_pronouns: To print them on your name tag.
privacy_remarks: Depends on what you write in the field. Generally, we use the data in the field to respond to your remarks.
registration_open: Registration and Call for Participation open now
signup_accessibility_help: All data will be deleted after the conference.
signup_accessibility_info: We aim to make the conference as accessible as possible. If you need assistance in any way (wheelchair-accessible rooms, sign interpretation, allergen-free snacks, ...), please tell us.
signup_accommodation_info: For groups of several people, we recommend Airbnb as a relatively affordable option. There is also a youth hostel in Heidelberg near the university, but the prices there are somewhat higher. Additionally, we will organize Coli Couchsurfing, where you can stay with other Computational Linguistics students from Heidelberg.
signup_legend: Registration for the 35th TaCoS, May 21st to 23rd, 2026
sponsors_description: An event like TaCoS would not be possible without the support of sponsors. Therefore, we are very grateful for our sponsors:
sponsors_description_costs: Your sponsorship will finance, for example, accommodation for participants, meals, materials for workshops and lectures, and promotional materials. Beyond financial support, we also welcome donations in kind, such as promotional gifts that we can distribute to participants.
sponsors_lead: We are still looking for further sponsors. If you or your company are interested in supporting us, please contact us at
tacos_registration_started_description: Starting now, you can register as an attendee and (if you want) submit a contribution. All information about that can be found here:
team_additional_description: They are supported by a team of other fantastic students:
team_organizers_description: The main organizers of this TaCoS are Valentin Höpfl and Aaron Henning.
timetable_description: And this is where you come in: Have you always wanted (or maybe only now want) to give a presentation about a topic you're passionate about? Now is your time! Submit your contribution to our platform “TaCoStage” by March 31, 2026. Once the submission deadline has passed, we will arrange the accepted contributions into a program and publish it here.
timetable_description_lead: TaCoS thrives on your contributions in the form of presentations, interactive workshops, and lightning talks.
until_then_text: Until then, go check out the websites of previous conferences:
what_is_description:
TaCoS (“Tagung der Computerlinguistik-Studierenden”) is an annual conference that has been organized entirely by student volunteers since 1992. It covers the fields of computational linguistics, language technology, computational humanities, artificial intelligence, and natural language processing.

At the conference, students present their work in the form of talks and workshops. Whether the work is a thesis, a seminar project, current research, or a pet project, TaCoS has a place for almost anything that is interesting.  In addition to the student presentations, established scientists from the host university are invited as keynote speakers. There is also a social program that offers all participants the opportunity to make contacts and network.

In short, TaCoS is a place to meet others from your own field of study, learn something new, and have fun.
registration_successful_details: You've successfully and bindingly registered for 35th TaCoS 2026 in Heidelberg. See you in May!
registration_further_info_mail: At the latest at the start of April, you will receive another mail with more information.
you_will_receive_confirmation_mail: You will receive a confirmation mail. Only after clicking the link in the mail will your registration become binding.
interested_in_junge_sprawi: I want to receive informations about Junge Sprachwissenschaft e. V. via mail.
reduced_attendance_fee_is_5: For members of Junge Sprachwissenschaft e. V., there is a reduced attendance fee of 5 €.
